newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Austrian Fin Min sees French budget as EMU problem.
newsitem.headline: Austrian Fin Min sees French budget as EMU problem.

text.p: Austrian Finance Minister Rudolf Edlinger said on Monday that the state of the French budget was a problem for Europe's economic and monetary union (EMU).
"France is a problem," Austrian journalists quoted him as saying. "It shouldn't be that one country is looking at 3.6 (percent deficit/GDP ratio) and another at 3.0. This distorts competition."
Edlinger was speaking on the sidelines of a European Union finance ministers meeting in Brussels.

The new French government has said that it not likely to meet the Maastricht treaty criterion of a budget deficit of no more than 3.0 percent of GDP this year, but that it still expects to qualify for the single currency.

The issue has underlined differences within the European Union between those countries demanding a strict interpretation and those seeeking some leeway in qualifying for the single currency. -- Brussels Newsroom ++ 32 2 287 6830
